intro: Richetia obovoidea, commonly known as the broad-ovate richetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often lobed and have a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Richetia obovoidea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
